body:
There are a few checks that are currently only done at macro invocation time (or are not done at all) that really would make more sense to do a macro definition time.

This is a tracking issue to implement these checks.

- [x] Checking that the Kleene operator used in the body is the same as that in the matcher (#62008)
    - https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=b440f281efd992b9522275950e5689c2
- [x] Checking that all meta-variables used in the body are defined and in scope (#62008)
    - https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=2d569d0d34213bbab2f1f2a9485546fd
- [x] Checking that all meta-variables used in the body are repeating at the right depth (#62008)
    - https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=c8adccf18462bb0955e786ceb1fdd1b7
- [x] ~Checking that the body of a macro is actually valid rust syntax (to the extent that we can, anyway)~
    - https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=55fee22139ff7ef1f9470cd048e62885
    - This might be impossible... leaving it off for now...

- Maybe fix false positives/negatives
- Possibly propose not using kleene op on RHS
